etymologies: late 16th century. From classical Latin adversāria things written on one side of the page, notes, observations (Cicero), in post-classical Latin also commonplace book, use as noun (short for scripta adversāria) of neuter plural of adversārius

definitions: With plural agreement: miscellaneous remarks and observations; notes, miscellanea. With singular agreement: a book consisting of these, a commonplace book.
